body_html:
How do I change it so that when I call import TensorFlow, it comes from my specified directory (cloned dir) and not the one in dist-packages?

I think that's the more important part of the question.

Often you can just pip install -e ... but I don't see any way to install tensorflow in an "editable" mode so you can easily try out changes, without rebuilding/reinstalling the wheel.

Am I missing something? Is there a simple way?
body_text:
How do I change it so that when I call import TensorFlow, it comes from my specified directory (cloned dir) and not the one in dist-packages?

I think that's the more important part of the question.
Often you can just pip install -e ... but I don't see any way to install tensorflow in an "editable" mode so you can easily try out changes, without rebuilding/reinstalling the wheel.
Am I missing something? Is there a simple way?
body:
> How do I change it so that when I call import TensorFlow, it comes from my specified directory (cloned dir) and not the one in dist-packages? 

I think that's the more important part of the question.

Often you can just `pip install -e ...` but I don't see any way to install tensorflow in an "editable" mode so you can easily try out changes, without rebuilding/reinstalling the wheel.

Am I missing something? Is there a simple way?
